Package be.anticair.anticairapi.keycloak.controller

Class GroupController

java.lang.Object
be.anticair.anticairapi.keycloak.controller.GroupController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/groups") public class GroupController extends Object
REST Controller for managing user groups in Keycloak.
Author:
Zarzycki Alexis

  • Method Details

    • getGroups

      @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @GetMapping("/") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Map<String,Object>>> getGroups()
      Get all the groups in the keycloak realm.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a success message.

    • getGroupsFromUser

      @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @GetMapping("/{emailId}/groups") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<Map<String,Object>>> getGroupsFromUser(@RequestParam String emailId)
      Get all the groups for a user.
      Parameters:
      emailId - the email of the user to get the groups for.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of groups the user belongs to.

    • addGroup

      @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @PostMapping("/add") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> addGroup(@RequestParam String emailId, @RequestParam String groupName)
      Adds a user to a specified group in Keycloak.
      Parameters:
      emailId - the email of the user to be added to the group.
      groupName - the name of the group to which the user will be added.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a success message.

    • removeGroup

      @PreAuthorize("hasAuthority(\'ROLE_Admin\')") @PostMapping("/remove") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Map<String,String>> removeGroup(@RequestParam String emailId, @RequestParam String groupName)
      Removes a user from a specified group in Keycloak.
      Parameters:
      emailId - the email of the user to be removed from the group.
      groupName - the name of the group from which the user will be removed.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing a success message.

    • handleNotFoundException

      @ExceptionHandler(jakarta.ws.rs.NotFoundException.class) @ResponseStatus(NOT_FOUND) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleNotFoundException(jakarta.ws.rs.NotFoundException ex)
      Handles exceptions when a user or group is not found in Keycloak.
      Parameters:
      ex - the NotFoundException thrown when the user or group is not found.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a 404 status and an error message.

    • handleRuntimeException

      @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.RuntimeException.class) @ResponseStatus(INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> handleRuntimeException(RuntimeException ex)
      Handles general runtime exceptions.
      Parameters:
      ex - the RuntimeException thrown during processing.
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a 500 status and an error message.
